title: Expressive probabilistic sampling in recurrent neural networks. (arXiv:2308.11809v1 [q-bio.NC])
abstract: In sampling-based Bayesian models of brain function, neural activities are assumed to be samples from probability distributions that the brain uses for probabilistic computation. However, a comprehensive understanding of how mechanistic models of neural dynamics can sample from arbitrary distributions is still lacking. We use tools from functional analysis and stochastic differential equations to explore the minimum architectural requirements for $\textit{recurrent}$ neural circuits to sample from complex distributions. We first consider the traditional sampling model consisting of a network of neurons whose outputs directly represent the samples (sampler-only network). We argue that synaptic current and firing-rate dynamics in the traditional model have limited capacity to sample from a complex probability distribution. translated_title: 在循环神经网络中的表达性概率抽样
translated_abstract: 在基于采样的大脑功能贝叶斯模型中，假设神经活动是来自大脑用于概率计算的概率分布样本。然而，对于神经动力学机制模型如何从任意分布中进行抽样仍然缺乏全面理解。我们使用函数分析和随机微分方程的工具来探索$\textit{循环}$神经电路从复杂分布中进行抽样的最小架构要求。首先我们考虑传统的采样模型，它由一个神经元网络组成，其输出直接表示样本（仅采样器网络）。我们认为传统模型中的突触电流和发放率动力学能够从复杂概率分布中进行抽样的能力有限。我们证明了一个带有单独的输出单元集的循环神经电路的发放率动力学可以从任意概率分布中进行抽样。
tldr: 该论文探索了循环神经电路如何从复杂概率分布中进行抽样，并证明了带有单独输出单元的神经电路的发放率动力学可以从任意概率分布中进行抽样。
en_tdlr: This paper explores how recurrent neural circuits can sample from complex probability distributions, and demonstrates that the firing rate dynamics of neural circuits with separate output units can sample from arbitrary probability distributions.
